intro: Chassalia stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers make it easily identifiable. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
